contentrichtext.text: '''Bull Run''' may refer to: ==Battles== * [[First Battle of Bull Run]] (First Manassas), the first major battle of the American Civil War * [[Second Battle of Bull Run]] (Second Manassas), a later battle that took place at Bull Run ==Place names== In the United States: * [[Bull Run, Virginia]], a census-designated place in Prince William County * [[Bull Run (Occoquan River)]], a stream in Fairfax, Loudoun, and Prince William counties, Virginia, site of the Civil War battles * [[Bull Run Mountains]], a mountain range in Fauquier, Loudoun, and Prince William counties, Virginia * [[Bull Run Mountains (Nevada)]], a mountain range in Elko County, Nevada * [[Bull Run River (Oregon)]] ** [[Bull Run Hydroelectric Project]], a dam project on the Bull Run River ** [[Bull Run, Oregon]], an unincorporated community named for the river ** [[Bull Run National Forest]], a former national forest ==Other uses== * [[Bull Run (novel)|''Bull Run'' (novel)]], a young adult novel by Newbery Honor winner Paul Fleischman about 16 characters at the First Battle of Bull Run * ''[[Bullrun]]'', a reality television show on Spike TV based on the Bullrun road rally * [[Running of the Bulls]] (Spanish ''Encierro''), events such as found in Pamplona, Spain * A "bull run" or "bull market", an economic trend; see [[Market trends]] {{disambig}}
